goals: Establish current max baselines on deadlift
Establish current max baselines on back squat
Establish current max baselines on bench press
Establish current max baselines on push press
Improve movement quality through integrated mobility work
Maintain conditioning capacity through finishers and one longer session weekly
programContext.purpose: Conservative progression block focusing on the four main powerlifting movements (deadlift, back squat, bench press, push press) culminating in max testing in week 4 to establish new baselines. Designed for masters athlete with limited recovery capacity.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Lower Body Strength - Squat Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build volume tolerance on back squat with moderate intensity. Establish baseline movement quality and integrate mobility work for shoulders and hips.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Focus on depth consistency and bracing. Film your squats for form analysis. RPE should be 7-8, sustainable but challenging. Scale weight if form breaks down.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip openers, thoracic extensions on foam roller, shoulder pass-throughs with PVC, goblet squat holds, leg swings. Focus on upper back and shoulder mobility.
2-second pause at bottom. Focus on chest up, weight mid-foot, knees tracking toes. Build strength in bottom position. Film your sets.
Per leg. Upright torso, front knee tracks over toes. Control descent. Leverage your unilateral strength.
Hinge at hips, bar close to shins. Feel stretch in hamstrings. Build posterior chain volume.
12 cal Assault Bike, 15 KB Swings (53lbs), 20 Air Squats. Moderate pace, conversational to moderate breathlessness.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Upper Body Strength - Bench Press Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build volume on bench press leveraging existing upper body strength. Integrate pulling volume and shoulder mobility work.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Bench is a strength - push the volume here. Focus on bar path and leg drive. RPE 7-8. Pulling volume high to balance pressing.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Shoulder pass-throughs, band pull-aparts, thoracic extensions, scapular wall slides, light band rows. Address shoulder and upper back restrictions.
Focus on bar path over mid-chest, leg drive, maintain arch. Control descent, explosive press. This is your strength - own it.
Full range of motion, chest to bar. Scale to banded if needed to maintain quality reps. Leverage your pulling strength.
Per hand. Control descent, press to full extension. Build upper chest volume.
Minute 1: 12 cal Row, Minute 2: 15 Push-ups. Alternate for 10 minutes. Maintain consistent pace.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Posterior Chain - Deadlift Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build deadlift volume with technical focus. Address hip hinge mechanics and posterior chain development.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Deadlift is a priority weak point. Focus on setup, bracing, and keeping chest up through the pull. Film your work sets. RPE 7-8.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip flexor stretches, hamstring stretches, thoracic mobility, cat-cow, deadlift setup drills with PVC. Prime the posterior chain.
Setup: weight mid-foot, chest up, lats engaged. Pull: chest and hips rise together, bar close to shins. Film your sets - this is priority work.
Touch plates to floor each rep. Explosive pull to sternum. Build back thickness.
Per leg. Hinge at hip, maintain neutral spine. Feel hamstring stretch. Balance and posterior chain work.
Pull to upper chest, squeeze shoulder blades. Control eccentric. Build lat width.
400m Run, 20 KB Swings (53lbs), 30 Sit-ups. Moderate pace, focus on breathing rhythm.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Upper Body Pressing - Push Press Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build push press volume with leg drive emphasis. Respect shoulder mobility limitations with modified ROM work.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Push press uses leg drive to reduce shoulder ROM demand. Focus on timing of dip and drive. Stop at comfortable overhead position - do not force full ROM.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Shoulder circles, band pull-aparts, thoracic extensions, scapular CARs, empty bar press to comfortable position. Work shoulder mobility progressively.
Dip: 4 inches, knees forward. Drive: explosive hip extension. Press to comfortable overhead position. Timing is key - feel the leg drive transfer to bar.
Elbows tucked, bar to lower chest. Build tricep strength for pressing power.
Per arm. Hand on bench for support. Pull to hip, squeeze lat. Control descent.
Pull to face level, external rotation at end. Build rear delts and upper back health.
Min 1: 10 cal Row, Min 2: 15 Wall Balls (20lbs), Min 3: 10 Burpees. Repeat 4 rounds. Sustainable pace.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Full Body Strength - Squat Variation
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Front squat focus to build quad strength and improve squat mechanics. Full body accessory work.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Front squats improve upright torso position and quad development. Keep elbows high, chest up. This transfers to back squat strength.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Wrist stretches, thoracic rotations, ankle mobility, goblet squat holds, front rack position work. Prep for front squat.
Elbows high, chest up, weight on heels. Upright torso throughout. Build quad strength and improve squat mechanics.
Increased range of motion. Focus on keeping chest up from the floor. Builds bottom position strength.
Total steps. Upright torso, knee tracks toes. Your unilateral strength is excellent - push the volume here.
Max reps each set. Full ROM. Rest 2 minutes between sets.
10 cal Assault Bike, 15 KB Swings (53lbs), 20 Air Squats. Count total rounds. Steady pace.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Longer Conditioning Session
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build aerobic capacity and work capacity with CrossFit-style workout. Maintain conditioning without compromising strength recovery.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your longer conditioning day. Moderate to high intensity based on recovery. Focus on breathing rhythm and pacing. Scale as needed.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Light jog, arm circles, leg swings, air squats, inchworms, jumping jacks. Get heart rate up.
5 Pull-ups, 10 Push-ups, 15 Air Squats. Count total rounds + reps. Pace for consistency - aim for 13-15 rounds. Scale pull-ups to banded if needed.
Light walk, static stretching: hamstrings, hip flexors, chest, shoulders. Focus on breathing and recovery.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Complete Rest Day
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Full recovery day. No training. Focus on sleep, nutrition, and active recovery activities.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your mandatory rest day. No lifting, no conditioning. Optional: light walking, stretching, foam rolling. Prioritize 7-8 hours sleep.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip flexors, hamstrings, quads, chest, shoulders, thoracic spine. Hold each stretch 30-60 seconds. Focus on problem areas.
Quads, IT bands, glutes, lats, upper back. Slow passes, pause on tender spots. Recovery work.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Lower Body Strength - Squat Focus Week 2
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Progress squat volume with slight load increase. Continue building movement quality and volume tolerance.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 5lb increase from Week 1. Focus remains on depth and bracing. Film your squats. RPE should still be 7-8.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip openers, thoracic extensions, shoulder mobility, goblet squat holds, leg swings. Standard prep.
2-second pause at bottom. 5lb increase from last week. Maintain quality - depth, chest up, bracing. Film your work sets.
Sit back to box, pause 1 second, explode up. Build posterior chain engagement in squat.
Per leg. 5lb increase. Maintain upright torso, control descent.
Control eccentric, squeeze at top. Build hamstring volume.
200m Run, 15 KB Swings (53lbs), 20 Air Squats, 15 Sit-ups. Rest 1 min between rounds. Moderate pace.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Upper Body Strength - Bench Press Week 2
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Progress bench press volume. Continue high pulling volume for balance.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 5lb increase on bench. This is your strength - push the intensity. Maintain pulling volume to balance pressing work.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Shoulder pass-throughs, band pull-aparts, thoracic extensions, scapular work, light pressing warm-up.
5lb increase. Bar path, leg drive, arch. You've got this weight - execute with confidence.
Per hand. Chest on bench eliminates cheating. Squeeze shoulder blades. Build mid-back.
2 more reps than last week. Full ROM. Scale to banded if needed for quality.
Per hand. Full ROM, control descent. Volume work for chest.
Min 1: 15 cal Row, Min 2: 20 Push-ups, Min 3: 15 Box Step-ups (20in). Repeat 4 rounds.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Posterior Chain - Deadlift Week 2
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Progress deadlift volume with load increase. Continue posterior chain development.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 5lb increase on deadlift. This is priority work. Film your sets. Focus on chest staying up through the pull.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip mobility, hamstring stretches, thoracic work, cat-cow, deadlift setup drills.
5lb increase. Setup: weight mid-foot, chest up, lats engaged. Feel chest and hips rise together. Film your work sets.
Hinge at hips, bar close to legs. Feel hamstring stretch. Build posterior chain volume.
10lb increase. Explosive pull to sternum. Touch plates each rep.
Per leg. 5lb increase. Hinge at hip, neutral spine, feel hamstring stretch.
12 cal Assault Bike, 20 KB Swings (53lbs), 30 Air Squats, 20 Sit-ups. Count total rounds.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Upper Body Pressing - Push Press Week 2
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Progress push press with load increase. Continue shoulder mobility work and balanced pressing/pulling.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 5lb increase on push press. Focus on timing of dip and drive. Stop at comfortable overhead position.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Shoulder circles, band work, thoracic extensions, scapular mobility, empty bar pressing.
5lb increase. Dip and drive timing. Feel leg drive transfer to bar. Press to comfortable overhead position.
Reduced ROM. Build lockout strength and overload top position. Explosive press.
Add weight. Full ROM. Build pulling strength.
Per hand. Press to comfortable overhead position. Control descent. Volume work.
400m Run, 20 KB Swings (53lbs), 15 Box Jumps (24in), 20 Push-ups. Rest 90 sec between rounds.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Full Body Strength - Deadlift Variation
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Sumo deadlift variation to address different muscle recruitment. Full body accessory work.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Sumo deadlift emphasizes quads and adductors differently. Wide stance, vertical torso. Experiment with stance width.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip mobility, adductor stretches, ankle mobility, sumo stance practice, thoracic work.
Wide stance, toes out 30 degrees, vertical torso. Chest up, push knees out. Different muscle recruitment than conventional.
3 second descent, 1 second pause, explosive up. Build control and time under tension.
Total steps. 5lb increase. Your unilateral strength is excellent - keep pushing volume.
Max reps with 25lbs. Full ROM. Rest 2 min between sets.
Min 1: 10 cal Bike, Min 2: 15 KB Swings (53lbs), Min 3: 20 Air Squats. Repeat 5 rounds.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Longer Conditioning Session Week 2
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Build work capacity with varied modality CrossFit workout. Maintain conditioning without compromising recovery.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Higher volume than last week. Pace for consistency. This builds your aerobic base without crushing recovery.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Light jog, dynamic stretches, movement prep for workout movements.
400m Row, 15 KB Swings (53lbs), 15 Box Jumps (24in). Target 20-25 minutes. Pace for consistency - don't blow up early.
Light walk, static stretching. Focus on breathing and recovery.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Complete Rest Day
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Full recovery day. No training. Prioritize sleep, nutrition, and recovery protocols.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Mandatory rest day. You've completed 2 weeks of volume work. Recovery is where adaptation happens. Optional mobility work only.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Full body stretching routine. Hold stretches 30-60 seconds. Focus on shoulders, hips, hamstrings.
Quads, IT bands, glutes, lats, upper back. Slow passes. Active recovery.
Easy pace. Fresh air. Mental reset. No intensity.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Heavy Deadlift + Upper Pull Volume
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Intensification phase deadlift work at 87% with reduced volume. Focus on explosive power off the floor and lockout strength. Upper body pulling volume to support back development.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your first intensification phase deadlift session. 87% should feel heavy but manageable for triples. Focus on explosive initiation and maintaining position throughout. If form breaks down, reduce to 85%. Rest 3-4 minutes between deadlift sets. Conditioning finisher should be moderate intensity - don't crush yourself.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Explosive off the floor, maintain chest position throughout pull. Feel your lats engage before you initiate. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. Film your heaviest set for review.
Control the eccentric, feel the stretch in your hamstrings. Keep bar close to legs throughout. This builds your posterior chain for deadlift strength.
Full range of motion, control the descent. These build your back thickness for deadlift support. Scale to bodyweight if needed to maintain quality reps.
Dead stop each rep, explosive pull to sternum. Keep torso parallel to ground. Build upper back strength for deadlift lockout.
EMOM format: 250m row on the minute for 5 minutes. Target 50-55 seconds per round, use remaining time as rest. Moderate intensity, conversational pace.
Between row rounds: 15 swings immediately after stepping off rower. Hip hinge power, squeeze glutes at top. This finisher maintains conditioning without crushing recovery.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Heavy Bench Press + Tricep Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Intensification bench work at 90% for doubles. This is your strength - leverage it. Heavy pressing followed by targeted tricep work to support lockout strength.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 90% for doubles should feel heavy but controlled. Focus on leg drive and maintaining upper back tightness throughout. You're strong here - don't hold back. Rest 3-4 minutes between bench sets. The accessory work supports your bench press lockout strength.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Full setup: leg drive, upper back tight, controlled descent to chest, explosive press. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. This is heavy - focus on quality bar path and maintaining position.
Hands inside shoulder width, elbows tucked. This builds tricep strength for bench lockout. Control the eccentric, explosive concentric.
Per hand weight. Full range of motion, control the stretch at bottom. Builds upper chest and shoulder stability within your ROM limits.
Per hand. Keep upper arms vertical, lower behind head, extend to lockout. Strict form, feel tricep stretch and contraction.
10-minute AMRAP: 10 cal bike, 10 push-ups, 10 sit-ups. Moderate pace, sustainable effort. This maintains conditioning without compromising upper body recovery.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Heavy Back Squat + Quad Focus
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Intensification squat work at 88% for triples. This is a weak point - time to address it systematically. Focus on depth consistency and maintaining position throughout the lift.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 88% should feel challenging but manageable for triples. Film your heaviest set - I want to see depth consistency. If you're not hitting depth, reduce weight until form is solid. This is where we build your squat. Rest 3-4 minutes between squat sets.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Full depth every rep - hip crease below knee. Keep chest up, core braced. Feel your weight stay mid-foot throughout. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets. Film your third set for form review.
2 second pause at full depth. This builds strength in the hole and reinforces proper depth. Stay tight during the pause, explode up.
Per hand. This is a strength for you - use it. Full range, knee tracking over toe. Builds single leg strength and addresses imbalances.
If no machine available, use resistance band. Quad isolation work to build knee extension strength. Control the eccentric, squeeze at the top.
24-30 inch box. Explosive jump, soft landing, step down. Builds explosive power for squat drive out of the hole.
EMOM 8 minutes: 12 cal bike each minute. Target 35-40 seconds per round. Moderate-high intensity, sustainable pace. Legs will be fatigued - push through it.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Heavy Push Press + Shoulder Accessory
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Intensification push press work at 87% for triples. Focus on explosive leg drive and efficient transfer to overhead position. Respect shoulder ROM limitations.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: 87% push press should feel heavy but explosive. Focus on timing of leg drive and press. Don't force overhead ROM beyond your mobility - stop where you can maintain position. The dumbbell work respects your shoulder limitations while building strength.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Explosive leg drive, aggressive press. Stop at your comfortable overhead position - don't force full ROM. Rest 3 minutes between sets. Feel the power transfer from legs to bar.
Per hand. Neutral grip is more shoulder-friendly. Explosive leg drive, press to comfortable overhead position. Builds unilateral pressing strength.
Per arm. Angle of press is shoulder-friendly. Full extension, control the eccentric. Builds pressing strength without extreme overhead ROM.
Raise to shoulder height, control down. Builds lateral delt strength. Light weight, strict form, feel the burn.
Use resistance band. Pull to face, external rotation at end. Builds rear delts and upper back for shoulder health. High reps, feel the squeeze.
For time. Target 8-9 minutes. Moderate intensity, sustainable pace. Focus on good rowing mechanics - legs, hips, arms on the drive.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Deadlift Variation + Full Body Power
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Deficit deadlifts to build strength off the floor. Full body power development with Olympic lift variations and explosive movements.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Deficit deadlifts are humbling but effective. Use 1-2 inch deficit (plates under feet). This builds explosive power off the floor for your conventional deadlift. The power work maintains athleticism and explosiveness.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Stand on 1-2 inch platform (plates work). Increases range of motion and builds strength off the floor. Maintain position throughout - don't let hips shoot up. Rest 3 minutes between sets.
Explosive hip extension, fast elbows. Catch in quarter squat. Builds explosive power for all lifts. Focus on speed and timing, not max weight.
Use cross arm grip if wrist mobility is limited. Upright torso, full depth. Builds quad strength and reinforces good squat mechanics.
Per arm (8 each arm). Explosive hip extension, punch overhead. Builds unilateral power and overhead stability within your ROM.
For time. 24-30 inch box. Break into manageable sets. Explosive jumps, soft landings, step down. Builds explosive power and conditioning.
Alternate with box jumps in conditioning piece. Overhead swing (if shoulder allows) or russian swing. Hip hinge power, explosive.
Finish with 50 cal bike for time. Target under 3 minutes. High intensity finish to the session. This is a grind - embrace it.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Longer Conditioning - CrossFit Style Chipper
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Extended conditioning session with varied movements and moderate loading. Build work capacity and mental toughness while maintaining strength gains.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your longer conditioning day. Pace this intelligently - it's 30+ minutes of work. Break movements into manageable sets. Focus on consistent movement, not max effort sprints. This builds your engine without compromising strength recovery.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: For time chipper: 1000m row to start. Moderate pace, save energy for the work ahead. Target 4:30-5:00.
After row: 50 thrusters. Break into sets of 10-15. Full squat, press overhead to lockout. This will be a grind.
40 pull-ups after thrusters. Break into small sets. Kipping allowed if you have the skill, otherwise strict. Chin over bar each rep.
30 box jumps. 24 inch box. Full hip extension at top, step down. Legs will be smoked - focus on safe landings.
Per hand. 20 reps each arm. Alternating or both arms together. Explosive leg drive, press to comfortable overhead position.
Finish with 1000m row. Empty the tank here. Target under 4:30. This is where mental toughness is built. Total target time: 25-35 minutes.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Active Recovery & Mobility
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Complete rest day. Optional light mobility work to address shoulder and upper back restrictions. This is non-negotiable recovery time.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your mandatory rest day. Do nothing strenuous. If you feel good, do the optional mobility work below - your shoulders and upper back need it. Otherwise, just rest. Sleep, eat, recover. You've earned it. Come back Monday ready to work.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Optional: Arm circles, band pull-aparts, doorway stretches, sleeper stretch. Gentle movement to improve overhead position over time.
Optional: Lie on foam roller lengthwise or over bench. Arms overhead, gentle extension. Builds upper back mobility for better overhead position.
Optional: 90/90 stretch, pigeon pose, couch stretch, hip flexor stretches. Supports squat and deadlift mobility.
Optional: Easy 15-20 minute walk. Fresh air, clear the head, light movement. Nothing strenuous.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Deload Day - Active Recovery
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Strategic deload to dissipate accumulated fatigue before max testing. Light movement with mobility emphasis to prepare for testing week.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is a true deload - weights should feel very light. Focus is on movement quality and recovery, not intensity. If anything feels heavy or grindy, reduce load further. This sets up your max testing success.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Band pull-aparts, wall slides, thoracic rotations. Take your time, feel the positions.
50% of working max. 2-second pause in the hole. Focus on perfect depth and positioning. Should feel like a warm-up.
50% of working max. Controlled tempo, feel the bar path. Zero grind.
Controlled reps, full ROM. Stop well short of failure.
Easy conversational pace. This is recovery, not a workout. Target 2:15-2:20/500m pace.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Max Testing - Deadlift
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Establish true 1RM deadlift baseline. Conservative progression to max with proper warm-up structure.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is about finding your TRUE max today, not chasing a number. Take full rest between attempts (3-5 min). Stop if form breaks down - a safe max is better than an ugly max. Film your heavy attempts for analysis.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Leg swings, hip circles, deep bodyweight squats, good mornings. Get loose.
Bar only or 135. Focus on setup and positioning.
Should feel light and fast.
Starting to feel the weight. Check your setup.
Last warm-up single. Should move well.
Your recent 3RM weight. Should be solid. Rest 3-4 minutes.
Big jump. If 275 moved well, go for it. Rest 4-5 minutes.
Only if 295 moved well. If 295 was a grind, stay there or go 300. Rest 5 minutes before attempting.
Light pump work to flush the legs. Nothing heavy.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Max Testing - Back Squat
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Establish true 1RM back squat baseline. Conservative progression with emphasis on depth consistency.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Depth is non-negotiable - if you can't hit proper depth, it doesn't count. Film your heavy attempts. Take full rest between max attempts. This establishes your baseline for the next training block.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Hip circles, leg swings, deep squat hold, cossack squats. Get your hips and ankles ready.
Bar only or 95lbs. Establish your depth marker.
Should feel light. Check depth.
Starting to feel it. Depth still perfect.
Last warm-up single. Should move clean.
Conservative opener. Should be solid. Rest 3-4 minutes.
Your recent working weight. If 225 moved well, this should go. Rest 4-5 minutes.
Only if 245 moved well with good depth. If 245 was grindy, try 255 or stay at 245. Rest 5 minutes.
Light unilateral work per leg. Just movement, not intensity.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Active Recovery
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Complete rest or very light active recovery. No heavy lifting - your body needs to recover from max testing.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is optional. If you're feeling beat up from testing, take complete rest. If you want to move, keep it very light. No ego, no intensity.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Cat-cow, world's greatest stretch, hip circles, shoulder rolls. Move slowly and deliberately.
Conversational pace. You should be able to hold a full conversation. This is recovery, not training.
Hit hips, hamstrings, quads, shoulders, upper back. Hold each stretch 60-90 seconds.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Max Testing - Bench Press
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Establish true 1RM bench press baseline. Systematic progression to max with proper warm-up.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is your strongest lift - let's see what you've got. Full ROM required, pause on chest. Film your heavy attempts. Take adequate rest between max attempts (3-5 min).

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Arm circles, band pull-aparts, push-ups, scap push-ups. Get shoulders warm.
Bar or 95lbs. Feel the groove.
Should feel light and fast.
Add pause now. Check bar path.
Getting heavier. Maintain tightness.
Last warm-up single. Should move clean.
Your recent 3RM weight. Should be solid. Rest 3-4 minutes.
Big jump. If 255 flew, go for it. Rest 4-5 minutes.
Only if 275 moved well. If 275 was a grind, try 285 or stay. Rest 5 minutes.
Light tricep pump. Nothing heavy.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Max Testing - Push Press
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Establish true 1RM push press baseline. Respect shoulder mobility limitations, focus on explosive leg drive.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: Shoulder mobility matters here - don't force full overhead position if it's not there. Focus on explosive leg drive and lockout where you can. Film attempts. This is your weakest lift - establish honest baseline.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Band pull-aparts, wall slides, PVC pass-throughs, empty bar press. Get shoulders ready.
Bar or 65lbs. Feel the dip and drive.
Should feel light. Check your lockout position.
Getting heavier. Aggressive leg drive.
Last warm-up. Should move well.
Conservative opener. Should be solid. Rest 3-4 minutes.
If 155 moved well, go for it. Rest 4-5 minutes.
Only if 165 was clean. If 165 was grindy, try 170 or stay. Rest 5 minutes.
EMOM 5: 12 cal assault bike. Moderate pace, not maximal. Just moving after testing.

dailyWorkoutTemplates.name: Complete Rest Day
dailyWorkoutTemplates.description: Mandatory rest day. No training. Focus on recovery, nutrition, and sleep after max testing week.
dailyWorkoutTemplates.coachingNotes: This is non-negotiable. You just maxed out four lifts in one week. Your body needs complete rest. Walk if you want, stretch if you feel like it, but no structured training. Sleep, eat, recover.

prescribedExercises.formNotes: Do nothing. Sleep in. Eat well. Let your body recover from max testing week. Optional: light walk, gentle stretching.
